lines.lyrics: I found god
On the corner of first and Amistad

lines.chord: E     B   G#m      F#  B   E
lines.lyrics: Where the west was all but won

lines.chord: E   B  G#m F#         B    E
lines.lyrics: All alone smoking his last cigarette

lines.chord: E     B   G#m           F#  B  E
lines.lyrics: I Said where you been, he said ask anything
Where were you?
When everything was falling apart

lines.chord: G#m F#  E        F#    B      E
lines.lyrics: All my days were spent by the telephone
It never rang
And all I needed was a call
That never came
To the corner of first and Amistad
Lost and insecure
You found me, you found me
Lying on the floor
Surrounded, surrounded
Why’d you have to wait?
Where were you? Where were you?
Just a little late
You found me, you found me

lines.chord: G#m F# E   F#     B      E
lines.lyrics: In the end everyone ends up alone

lines.chord: G#m F# E    F#    B      E
lines.lyrics: Losing her, the only one who’s ever known
Who I am, who I’m not, who I want to be

lines.chord: B   F# E        F#            B          E
lines.lyrics: No way to know how long she will be next to me
Lost and insecure
You found me, you found me
Lying on the floor
Surrounded, surrounded
Why’d you have to wait?
Where were you? Where were you?
Just a little late
You found me, you found me

lines.chord: F#  B E        F# B E
lines.lyrics: Early morning, City breaks

lines.chord: F#   B    E           F#   B    E         F#   B    E
lines.lyrics: I’ve been calling for years and years and years and years
And you never left me no messages
You never send me no letters
You got some kind of nerve, taking all I want
Lost and insecure
You found me, you found me
Lying on the floor
Where were you where were you
Lost and insecure
You found me, you found me
Lying on the floor
Surrounded, surrounded
Why’d you have to wait?
Where were you? Where were you?
Just a little late
You found me, you found me
Why’d you have to wait?
To find me, to find me
